Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I don’t think anyone can avoid what they know. Especially when you write about them, your life is what you write about. Maybe what you don’t say about yourself is what makes you an artist – the stuff that you leave out.”

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africans. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The movie is as dark and harrowing as Apartheid itself, and done well. Are you really going to say this movie was terrible because it doesn't have a blatant message like Taken, or Constantine?

"Humor" is a word to use with caution in this movie i feel like. There is a lot of intellectual humor which pleasure us but also a lot of dark humor some of it isn't adapted to the general audience and even pityful a lot of times.
